Consts.useLimit:
BOEM will not assume any responsibility or liability for damages caused by errors or omissions in the original data set. BOEM has made efforts to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data; however, some errors may exist. Notifications of errors are appreciated and shall be reported to the BOEM Office of Public Affairs (see contact information below). Data is not intended to be used as legal documentation and shall not be constructed as such. The data was developed within the U.S. Government; no proprietary rights may be attached to them nor may they be sold to the U.S. Government as part of any procurement of ADP products or services. Data is not to be used for navigational purposes.

For more information please visit our webpage: https://www.boem.gov/

Office of Public Affairs, Gulf of Mexico OCS Region

1201 Elmwood Park Blvd.

New Orleans, LA 70123-2394

Phone: 1-800-200-4853

dataIdInfo.idPurp: To show the areas that are currently under lease. Does not include old leases that are relinquished, terminated, or expired.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
OCS Lease Blocks that are currently leased from the federal government by industry for the purpose of development of traditional oil or gas energy products and may or may not be actively developed or producing. Leases in state waters are not included in this layer.

The Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act (OCSLA) (43 U.S.C. 1331-1356a), as amended, authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to issue, on a competitive basis, leases for oil and gas, and sulfur, in submerged lands of the Outer Continental Shelf. The Act authorizes the Secretary to grant rights-of-way and easements through the submerged lands of the OCS.

An OCS lease is an agreement that is issued under section 8 or maintained under section 6 of the Act and that authorizes exploration for, and development and production of, minerals on the OCS. The term also means the area covered by that agreement, whichever the context requires. The areas covered by the lease agreement consist of one or more OCS Lease Blocks, or any leasable portion thereof, bid upon as a single administrative unit, that will be part of a single lease.

This data set contains the outlines for active federal oil and gas leases in the Gulf of Mexico OCS Region. The file is updated on a monthy basis on or about the first of each month. The lease outlines represent a close approximation, but might not be the exact coordinates for those leases. For official coordinates please refer to the OPD or SOBD for the lease. All leasing in the GOM OCS Region is captured on a NAD27.

LegConsts.useLimit: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data to evaluate data set limitations, restrictions or intended use. The Bureau of Ocean Energy Management shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
LegConsts.othConsts: Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of BOEM would be appreciated.

graphOver.bgFileDesc: This application shows oil and gas Active Leases in the Gulf of Mexico

dataIdInfo.suppInfo: Other cadastre data for the Agency is available at: https://www.data.boem.gov/Main/Mapping.aspx, These data will include digital images of Agency data at the regional, planning area, Official Protraction Diagram (OPD), Supplemental Official OCS Block Diagram (SOBD)s and Digital Spatial Data in ArcMap format at the regional levels.

Indicates the method by which royalties are determined for a lease or potential lease.

40% fixed net profit share, 1.00 capital recovery factor
50% fixed net profit share, 0.25 capital recovery factor

attr.attrdef: Indicates whether an appeal to change lease status has been filed with the Interior Board of Land Appeals.
The date a lease expires, is relinquished or terminated.
The surface area of the Federally administered portion of an OCS lease which has been designated as containing areas other than current or previous Federal area.
Indicates whether a lease is **segregated**.
Indicates the type of mineral for which a lease is issued or a sale is held.
The effective date that the status is approved by the Minerals Management Service.
A number to uniquely identify the block(s) or portion of block(s) offered for lease in an Outer Continental Lease sale assigned by the Minerals Management Service.
Indicates the reason that a serial number is issued.

The number assigned to a lease by the regulatory agency having jurisdiction over mineral activity in the territory where the lease is located\ as applied to a cross reference number between the **segregated lease** and the original lease.
Indicates whether an appeal to overturn a change in lease status has been filed with an OCS Region.
Indicates whether the lease status is pending litigation.
Identifies the development stage of the lease as assigned by the Minerals Management Service's Office of Leasing and Environment.

edom.edomvd: A terminated lease whose acreage has been merged into another lease.
Operations/activities on all or part of lease suspended/temp prohibited on Reg Sup initiative. Lease term extended.
A lease whose initial term has ended by operation of law.
A lease segregated prior to 1979; held by production from or activity on the original lease.

An awarded lease not executed by an authorized official of the Bureau. A lease with the new NO-EXE status is a bid evaluated by RE and deemed acceptable. Adjudication awarded the lease to the company. The company chose to accept the lease and paid the balance of the bonus. However, the agency cannot sign the lease and make it effective/active (there could be various reasons for this decision). Therefore the bid never became a lease.
An awarded lease not executed by the bidder(s).
Initial term extended because of activity on the leased area.
Initial term extended by order of the director.
Initial term granted at request of the operator.
A lease within the initial term of the contract (5, 8, or 10 years).
A lease held by production of a mineral.
A high bid rejected by the authorized officer.
A lease voluntarily surrendered by the record title holders.
Renewable Energy Preliminary Term Pending SAP Review
Renewable Energy Site Assessment Pending COP Review
Initial term extended due to ordering or appro by Dir of SOO
Initial term extended due to ordering or appro by Dir of SOP
A lease extended beyond its primary terms and has ended by operation of law.
A lease (or portion thereof) included in an approved unit agreement.

attr.attrdef: The effective date that the status is approved by the Minerals Management Service.
The current total surface area of a leasehold including any assignments or changes thereto.
The anticipated day, month, and year on which the lease is scheduled to expire.
No domain information is available
attr.attrdefs: The percentage due the Federal Government on monies received from lease production.

attr.attrdef: The original surface area of a leasehold, unit, etc.
The numeric designation assigned by the Minerals Management Service to specifically identify an Outer Continental Shelf lease sale.
The rent per unit of area payable by the lessee on the first day of each lease year prior to discovery of minerals in paying quantity, on the leasehold.
The system date when the current lease status code is changed from previous lease status code **CONTAINS PROPRIETARY INFORMATION**
Indicates the fee charged for the application of a non-competitive lease. The amount is based on number of acres applied for.

attrvai.attrva: A global domain to allow numbers within a range from 0 to the highest possible value based on the maximum length and decimal length of the domain.

attr.attrdef: A code to indicate the type of auction format used to award the Renewable Energy Lease.
Indicates whether or not FERC approval is required.
A code specifying the type of Renewable Energy Lease.
Designates whether or not a particular lease has multiple renewable energy activities located on the lease.

The concatenation of the area_code data element value and the block_number data element value with the space formatting removed. For example, where a block_number value is " 128" and the area_code value is "MP", the AC_LAB value would be "MP128"
Length of feature in internal units.

distorCont.rpOrgName: Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Office of Leasing and Plans, Mapping and Automation Section

prcStep.stepDesc: The coordinate values and attributes were pulled from the TIMS database system and converted to ArcInfo files. All-of-block leases are built in longitude/latitude coordinates and cleaned at a resolution of .000001. Partial block leases are built in their OPD native projection zone. True curves are approximated with a series of straight line segments. Arc approximation is performed until one of two criteria is met: (a) the angular difference between adjacent curve approximation points reaches .01 degree, or (b) a maximum of 496 approximation points is used to redefine the true arc. Partial block leases are cleaned to a tolerance of .5 meters, then projected into longitude/latitude coordinates and combined with the coverage for all-of-block leases. The resultant coverage is then cleaned again to a tolerance of 0.000001.
